MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: Accountable Health Communities Health-Related Social Needs Screening Tool

ahc_hrsn_01.Description: What is your living situation today?

Levels.1: I have a steady place to live
Levels.2: I have a place to live today, but I am worried about losing it in the future
Levels.3: I do not have a steady place to live (I am temporarily staying with others, in a hotel, in a shelter, living outside on the street, on a beach, in a car, abandoned building, bus or train station, or in a park)

ahc_hrsn_02_0.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

ahc_hrsn_02_1.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

Levels.1: Pests such as bugs, ants, or mice

ahc_hrsn_02_2.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

ahc_hrsn_02_3.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

ahc_hrsn_02_4.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

ahc_hrsn_02_5.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

ahc_hrsn_02_6.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

Levels.6: Smoke detectors missing or not working

ahc_hrsn_02_7.Description: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following? Choose all that apply.

ahc_hrsn_03.Description: Some people have made the following statements about their food situation. Please answer whether the statements were OFTEN TRUE, SOMETIMES TRUE, or NEVER TRUE for you and your household in the last 12 months. Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got money to buy more.

Levels.1: Often true

ahc_hrsn_04.Description: Some people have made the following statements about their food situation. Please answer whether the statements were OFTEN TRUE, SOMETIMES TRUE, or NEVER TRUE for you and your household in the last 12 months. Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn't last and you didn't have money to get more.

Levels.1: Often true

ahc_hrsn_05.Description: In the past 12 months, has lack of reliable transportation kept you from medical appointments, meetings, work or from getting things needed for daily living?

Levels.1: Yes

ahc_hrsn_06.Description: In the past 12 months has the electric, gas, oil, or water company threatened to shut off services in your home?

Levels.1: Yes

ahc_hrsn_11.Description: How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating? Would you say it is...

Levels.1: Very hard

ahc_hrsn_13.Description: If for any reason you need help with day-to-day activities such as bathing, preparing meals, shopping, managing finances, etc., do you get the help you need?

Levels.1: I don't need any help
Levels.2: I get all the help I need
Levels.3: I could use a little more help
Levels.4: I need a lot more help

ahc_hrsn_14.Description: How often do you feel lonely or isolated from those around you?

Levels.1: Never

ahc_hrsn_15.Description: Do you speak a language other than English at home?

Levels.1: Yes

ahc_hrsn_17.Description: In the last 30 days, other than the activities you did for work, on average, how many days per week did you engage in moderate exercise (like walking fast, running, jogging, dancing, swimming, biking, or other similar activities)?

ahc_hrsn_18.Description: On average, how many minutes did you usually spend exercising at this level on one of those days?

ahc_hrsn_25.Description: Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions?

Levels.1: Yes

ahc_hrsn_26.Description: Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have difficulty doing errands alone such as visiting a doctor's office or shopping?

Levels.1: Yes
